child.publications: Thurgood, Graham Ward. 1994. Tai-Kadai and Austronesian: The Nature of the Historical Relationship, Oceanic Linguistics, No. 2 edn., vol. 33, 345-368.

root.pub-comments: Concerning the relationship between Tai-Kadai and Austronesian, Thurgood states that "only one conclusion is consistent with the overall patterning within TK [Tai-Kadai]: the An [Austronesian] forms are the product of language contact. [...] What these borrowed Austronesian forms argue quite eloquently for is a period of considerable, quite early, intimate contact between the Austronesian and the Tai-Kadai speakers" (1994:359; 361). In regards to Thurgood's findings affecting Benedict's Austro-Tai theory, he states that "as a purely genetic entity, these findings remove the core of Austro-Tai - there is now no real evidence Austronesian and Tai-Kadai are genetically related" (1998:362).
